12.7.18  8:56 am   I know you said that everyone will always find reason to complain about the current age, and that it's to take seriously once you realise that, but I feel like this time it is actually different.

      There will always be brilliant people and beautiful art, but I think almost every person has gained a high dependence on cell phones/social media/internet in just the last 5-6 years. These are companies like Instagram, Facebook, Whatsapp, Youtube etc that algorithmically feed content to entire societies, and/or keep them hooked using techniques that are known to be addictive. The whole IM thing too is a very unnatural way to speak to other people. I think all of this combined is disastrous for attention span, creativity, and normal social skills.

Do you think this is okay, and just a natural development of humanity?

      Or do you think that people should use less internet? Or maybe it's just not a problem at all. Nobody really seems to be talking abo ut it mu ch at all, I think probably because it has affected pretty much everybody.
